page.title: 01General Information
page.content: The locality of{Cults}and{Pitlessie}is situated in{North East Fife.}The whole area around these village settlements is of an agricultural and rural nature.The environment is one of farms surrounded by cultivated fields. The village of Pitlessie is the focal point of the area and is conveniently situated on the main{A92}trunk road, with{Cupar}the county town five miles to the north and the new town of {Glenrothes}eight miles to the south. The{River Eden}flows in a north easterly direction past the western edge of Pitlessie village towards Cupar and on to enter the sea at its estuary just above the university town of{St. Andrews. The land is part of the{Howe of Fife, a flat plain which is sheltered by the {Lomond Hills}in the west and Cults Hill to the south east.
